EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Use-case: Smelting basic materials.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: (0.0, 0.0))
– Iron Chest (position: (1.5, 0.5))

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (–16.0, –51.0)
Use-case: Extraction and preliminary processing of iron ore.
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill (position: (–16.0, –51.0))
– Burner Inserter (position: (–14.5, –49.5))  
  • Pickup: (–15.5, –49.5)  
  • Drop: (–13.5, –49.5)
– Transport Belt (position: (–15.5, –49.5))
– Iron Chest (output sink) (position: (–13.5, –49.5))
– Burner Inserter (position: (–14.5, –47.5))  
  • Associated Iron Chest: (–13.5, –47.5)
– Fast Inserter (position: (–12.5, –49.5))
– Sink Inserter (position: (–13.5, –45.5))  
  • Pickup: (–13.5, –46.5)  
  • Drop: (–13.5, –44.5)
– Belt Group connecting fast inserter drop (position: (–11.5, –49.5)) to sink inserter pickup (position: (–13.5, –46.5)) using 6 transport belts

### Copper Furnace at position (–27.0, –60.0)
Use-case: Processing copper ore.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: (–27.0, –60.0))  
  [warning: no ingredients to smelt]

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Use-case: Supporting research through integrated power and fluid supply.
Consists of:
– Lab (position: (0.5, 2.5))
– Offshore Pump (position: (–7.5, 25.5))
– Boiler (position: (2.0, 17.5))  
  [warning: no input liquid, no fluid present]
– Steam Engine (position: (5.5, 5.5))  
  [warning: not connected to power network, no input liquid]

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Use-case: Manufacturing of pipes.
Consists of:
– Assembling Machine (position: (3.5, 0.5))  
  [warning: not receiving electricity; cannot create pipe due to missing resource: iron-plate]
– Iron Chest (position: (1.5, 0.5))
– Electricity Network via Small Electric Poles (e.g., at positions (3.5, –1.5), (3.5, 2.5), (4.5, 3.5), …)

### Fluid Pipelines (Pipe Groups)
Use-case: Interconnecting fluid transport components.
Consists of multiple PipeGroups distributed across the map (for example, at positions (8.5, 5.5), (10.5, 4.5), (2.5, 9.5), (1.5, 11.5), (–1.5, 17.5), (6.5, 16.5), (–1.5, 21.5) and a working group at (–9.5, 9.5))

### Integrated Components
Use-case: Facilitate power distribution and link mined resources.
Consists of:
– Belt connections linking the BurnerMiningDrill’s output to designated sinks, now including the updated connection from fast inserter drop (position: (–11.5, –49.5)) to sink inserter pickup (position: (–13.5, –46.5))
– An Electricity Network integrated with Small Electric Poles forming an Electricity Group, now extended with a new pole (position: (–12.5, –48.5)) powering the fast inserter  
  • Note: An attempt to place an additional electric pole near the fast inserter failed due to a conflicting transport belt at (–11.5, –49.5)

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Transport Belt Connection Errors  
  – Ensure that the required quantity of transport belts is available before initiating a connection (e.g., required 6 vs. available 3).  
  – Confirm the connection path is unobstructed and valid to allow proper belt routing.

• Entity Placement Conflicts  
  – Check that target positions for entity placement (such as electric poles or inserters) are free of occupied tiles. Adjust spacing, direction, or reference positions to avoid collisions—as seen with the failed additional electric pole placement due to an existing transport belt.

• Output Sink Configuration Issues  
  – Align sink inserters consistently with their corresponding output sinks to prevent persistent output blockage warnings. Ensure that the connection between production output and sink entities (or their intermediary belts) is reliably maintained.

• Power Supply Connection Handling  
  – Verify that power-dependent entities (e.g., fast inserter) are correctly connected to electric poles. Reassess and adjust connectivity if “not receiving electricity” errors persist.

• Variable Naming and Definition  
  – Define all variables for newly placed entities clearly to avoid reference errors during execution.

• (Retained) Crafting and Furnace Resource Shortages  
  – Confirm that necessary raw materials and fuel are present before commencing smelting or crafting operations.

• (Retained) Fluid Connectivity and Intermediate Placement  
  – Ensure fluid connection points remain unblocked and properly aligned between entities.

────────────────────────
NAMESPACE
• get_entity(entity: Any, position: Any) -> Any  
  – Retrieves an entity of the specified type at the given position.  
   • Success: Returns the located entity.  
   • Failure: Raises an exception if not found.

• pipe_entity(pipe: entities.Pipe) -> Any  
  – Processes a pipe entity during pipeline connection routines.

• rotate_entity(entity: Any, direction: Any) -> Any  
  – Rotates the given entity to the specified direction for proper alignment.

• insert_item(resource: Any, target: Any, quantity: int) -> Any  
  – Inserts a specified quantity of a resource into the target inventory.

• get_connection_amount(virtual_candidate: Any, boiler_connection: Any, pipe_proto: Prototype.Pipe) -> int  
  – Calculates the number of pipe segments required to establish a fluid connection.

• place_entity_next_to(entity_type: Any, reference_position: Position, direction: Direction, spacing: int) -> Any  
  – Attempts to place an entity of the given type adjacent to a reference position using the specified direction and spacing.  
   • Success: As demonstrated by the successful placement of a fast inserter with increased spacing.  
   • Failure: Occurs if a collision is detected (e.g., with a transport belt).

Important Variables:
• pump_working (OffshorePump) – Holds the offshore pump entity at position (–7.5, 25.5).
• boiler_original (Boiler) – Represents the boiler entity at position (2.0, 17.5).
• candidate_intermediate_offpump (Position) – Candidate connection point for linking the Offshore Pump.
• candidate_intermediate_boiler (Position) – Candidate connection point for linking the Boiler.
• boiler_connection_point (Position) – Intended connection point for the boiler’s water supply.
• steam_engine_connection_point (Position) – Intended connection point for the Steam Engine’s input.
• pipe_count (int) – Tracks the current number of available pipes.
• distance (float) – Calculated distance for pipeline segments.
• final_inventory (Inventory) – Snapshot of inventory item counts after recent operations.
• virtual_candidate (Position) – Virtual candidate connection point used for manual pipe placement.
